intro: Ternstroemia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered ternstroemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded habitats. The fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
